docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Food ond Drug Administration has made final its ban on drugs and cosmetics that contain chloroform, but because it has ordered no recall, inventories of products that contain the chemical may still be on stores helves.

headline.main: CONSUMER NOTES; Chloroform Ban Has a Weak Spot

docs.abstract: FDA has banned use of chloroform in drugs and cosmetics but has ordered no recall of products that remain on store shelves because reptdly it does not believe amt of chloroform in products presents 'significant health hazard'; Dr Sidney Wolfe of Health Research Group deplores FDA refusal to recall products; NYS Consumer Protection Bd chmn Rosemary Pooler, in lr to FDA Comr Alexander M Schmidt, has expressed concern about existing stocks (M)
docs.snippet: The United States Food ond Drug Administration has made final its ban on drugs and cosmetics that contain chloroform, but because it has ordered no recall, inventories of products that contain the chemical may still be on stores helves.

docs.lead_paragraph: While some may call the egg a killer because of the cholesterol, there's no doubt it's also a life saver. Viruses used for vaccines may be grown within an egg. Fifty million or so egos were to be used to produce the vaccine for the swine-type influenza that was called a national threat just a few months ago.

headline.main: 50 Million Eggs Against Swine Flu; Vaccines Can Be Made, But What of Liability?

docs.abstract: Article on preparation of swine flu vaccine using 50-million eggs to incubate virus (S)
docs.snippet: While some may call the egg a killer because of the cholesterol, there's no doubt it's also a life saver. Viruses used for vaccines may be grown within an egg. Fifty million or so egos were to be used to produce the vaccine for the swine-type...

docs.lead_paragraph: The New Jersey Public Interest Research Group, a nonprofit organization affiliated with Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, has released a study that shows that the elderly pay a disproportionately higher share of the cost of prescription medicines.

headline.main: Consumer Notes; Medicines Held Costly for the Elderly

docs.abstract: unit has most of budget cuts restored (S)
docs.snippet: The New Jersey Public Interest Research Group, a nonprofit organization affiliated with Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, has released a study that shows that the elderly pay a disproportionately higher share of the cost of prescription medicines.
